verses.verse: but now you also must complete the doing of it; that as there was a readiness to desire it, so there also may be a completion out of what you have.
For (Mark 12:43, 44; Luke 21:3, 4; 2 Cor. 9:7) if there is first a willing mind, it is accepted according to what one has, and not according to what he does not have.
For I do not mean that others should be eased and you burdened;
but by an equality, that now at this time your abundance may supply their lack, that their abundance also may supply your lack—that there may be equality.
As it is written, (Ex. 16:18) “He who gathered much had nothing left over, and he who gathered little had no lack.”
(Collection for the Judean Saints) But thanks be to God who puts the same earnest care for you into the heart of Titus.
For he not only accepted the exhortation, but being more diligent, he went to you of his own accord.
And we have sent with him (1 Cor. 16:3; 2 Cor. 12:18) the brother whose praise is in the gospel throughout all the churches,

and not only that, but who was also (Acts 14:23; 1 Cor. 16:3, 4) chosen by the churches to travel with us with this gift, which is administered by us (2 Cor. 4:15) to the glory of the Lord Himself and to show your ready mind,
avoiding this: that anyone should blame us in this lavish gift which is administered by us—
(Rom. 12:17; Phil. 4:8; 1 Pet. 2:12) providing honorable things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.
And we have sent with them our brother whom we have often proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, because of the great confidence which we have in you.

If anyone inquires about (2 Cor. 7:13, 14) Titus, he is my partner and fellow worker concerning you. Or if our brethren are inquired about, they are ((John 13:16); Phil. 2:25) messengers of the churches, the glory of Christ.
Therefore show to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love and of our (2 Cor. 7:4, 14; 9:2) boasting on your behalf.
(Administering the Gift) Now concerning (Acts 11:29; Rom. 15:26; 1 Cor. 16:1; 2 Cor. 8:4; Gal. 2:10) the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you;
